intro: Hieracium erianthum f. aequatorianum, commonly known as the Ecuadorian hawkweed, is a variant of the common hawkweed species native to South America. It is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate climates and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Its botanical features include finely toothed leaves and a flowering structure composed of both ray and disk florets. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
